holidays.name: National Blonde Brownie Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration dedicated to the deliciously buttery and vanilla-flavored blonde brownie, often overshadowed by its famous chocolate sibling.
holidays.origin: While the exact origin is unclear, this unofficial food holiday emerged to honor the blondie‚Äîa dessert that amasses loyal fans who appreciate its unique flavor and chewy texture.
holidays.funFact: Blonde brownies, or blondies, are sometimes called "blondies" and have been delighting taste buds since the early 20th century as a chocolate-free alternative to brownies.

holidays.name: Answer Your Cat's Questions Day
holidays.description: A quirky day where cat owners take a moment to humorously ponder and 'answer' the many mysterious looks and 'questions' posed by their feline friends.
holidays.origin: An unofficial, fun pet holiday created by cat lovers who enjoy anthropomorphizing their cats' curious behaviors and expressions.
holidays.funFact: Cats are known to stare intensely at their owners, which many believe means they're asking silent questions‚Äîthis holiday embraces that playful imagination.

holidays.name: Celebration of Life Day
holidays.description: A day encouraging people to appreciate life, reflect on personal experiences, and embrace each moment with gratitude and joy‚Äîsometimes marked by acts of kindness or self-care.
holidays.origin: Though celebrated in various forms worldwide, this particular observance promotes positivity and mindfulness, often linked with mental health awareness.
holidays.funFact: Taking a moment to celebrate life can boost your mood and mental health, creating a ripple effect of happiness to those around you.

holidays.name: Pocket Protector Day
holidays.description: A humorous nod to the classic, often mocked, pocket protector worn by students, engineers, and nerds to keep pens safe and clothes clean.
holidays.origin: Originated as a tongue-in-cheek celebration of nerd culture and retro school accessories beloved in the 1950s-70s.
holidays.funFact: The pocket protector was invented in the 1940s to prevent ink stains, becoming a geek chic icon thanks to pop culture and geek stereotypes.
